intro: Stenotaenia elbursensis, commonly known as the Elburs mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Elburs Mountains in Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
